item.title: Introductory Tutorial On How To Use Object Orientation In C
item.description: Object-oriented programming is often used paradigm and estimated by developers of various aspects of computer science. On the other hand, imperative languages are also heavily used, in particular at medium and low-level system development languages. In this category, the C language stands out as the more popular imperative programming language. This popularity is due to its frequent use in large and interesting projects. Among these projects, we can mention the Linux, FreeBSD, NetBSD, Minix, Darwin and OpenBSD kernels, the GCC compiler, graphical libraries such as GTK etc.

item.title: Interesting Programming Languages: Squirrel
item.description: Squirrel is an interpreted object-oriented language in the Java, C++ sense. The language is inspired by several programming language stars. From Lua language, the Squirrel brings the small footprint interpreter, allowing to be used in limited resource hardware (low memory, low bandwidth etc.) making it suitable for real-time applications such as games app. Squirrel also is inspired by others languages like JavaScript and Python. The language is suitable to be used in open source and commercial projects because it is licensed under MIT license.

item.title: How to use X.509 certificates to sign content with javascript and Php - Part 1
item.description: #Introduction Some countries have digital signatures of electronic documents using X.509 certificates. Among countries that use this kind of certificate, we can mention Brazil with his e-CPF (for citizens) and e-CNPJ (for business). Usually, the applications in browser use Java Applet in order to sign some content with digital certificates. However, the browser such as Chrome is dropping the support for Java Applet and natives plugins such as NPAPI. To have the digital signature in web app we have to use browser API and some other js libraries.

item.title: How to list only the conflicted files in git?
item.description: Git is amazing! I really like it, but sometimes I have some difficult to read errors output when pull or merge. The solution is to list only the conflicted files. git diff --name-only --diff-filter=U That's all.

item.title: Interesting languages- IO
item.description: Iolang Io is a dynamic and expressive programming language. It is heavily based on Smalltalk, Self, NewtonScript, Act1,Lisp and Lua. From Smalltalk, Io language brings the idea that "all values are objects". The Self language contributes to Io with the prototype-based inheritance. Act1 was used as inspiration to bring actors and futures to the concurrency. Io also has modifiable AST and runtime inspection based on Lisp. The interpreter API can be easily used because its design has a similar simplicity of Lua embedding API.

item.title: Interesting Languages - Terra
item.description: C language uses the macro preprocessor to allow some control over the code logic. C++ uses the powerful template definitions to allow metaprogramming. However, C++ templates can be complex and inflexible to some valuable metaprogramming approach. This issue is solved by the Terra language. Terra means "earth" in the Portuguese language. This name comes from its counterpart and auxiliary language Lua (which means the moon in Portuguese). Terra is a fast low-level language that uses the Lua language as template and macro generator for impressive metaprogramming.

item.title: The fastest web framework for Go in (THIS) earth
item.description: I like the go language. It is simple to compile and has a lot of web framework and others gifts for programmers. Of course, it is not perfect, but it has very interesting features. This week, we found an interesting web framework built in Go language. This framework is named Iris. According to Iris developers, the framework is the fastest web framework for Golang up to date. Its benchmark states that iris can server more then 100 thousand requests per second.

item.title: Interesting languages: TCL
item.description: TCL is an interpreted programming language with minimalist language grammar, dynamic typing, automatic storage allocation and garbage collection and support for native Unicode. ###Introduction The TCL name means Tool Command Language. As the name states, the aims of the language is serve as an easy scripting programming language to be embedded in others applications or as a toolkit for task automation and fast prototyping. The language was created by by John Ousterhout in 1988 while working at the University of California, Berkeley.

item.title: Some programming languages to learn on the weekend.
item.description: Learning a new languages is a hobbie for me. That's why I am to happy on sharing 6 interesting lesser known interesting programming language. The first three languages, Terra, Io and Neck shares some features. The principal is its easiness on integration/embedding with/in others existent systems. This kind of languages are used usually to alloy bigger and complex system be customized and extended by a fancier language. The last two languages are languages that compile to native but bringing the best of scripting language, like Ruby, lisp, python etc.
